id: Zlatan Ibrahimovic beats Wayne Rooney to MLS award as he is crowned Newcomer of the Year
paragraph:
By

Danny Gallagher For Mailonline

Published:
  18:53 EST, 12 November 2018

 | 
Updated:
  18:58 EST, 12 November 2018

          19View  commentsZlatan Ibrahimovic came out on top against Wayne Rooney after winning the MLS Newcomer of the Year award.The striker was handed the accolade after a sublime debut season with LA Galaxy, in which he scored 22 goals and added 10 assists along the way in just 27 games.Ibrahimovic swapped the Premier League for America after failing to break his way back into the Manchester United set-up following a serious knee injury at the end of last season.Zlatan Ibrahimovic came out on top to win MLS Newcomer of the Year awardThe 36-year-old has been a revelation for LA Galaxy since moving from Manchester United🦁 Gave them Zlatan.@Ibra_official is @MLS Newcomer of the Year.To announce the winning of the award, LA Galaxy took to Twitter to share a video of Ibrahimovic and a lion - the animal he frequently compares himself to - leading into a highlights review of his incredible season.During his time in Major League Soccer Ibrahimovic also hit his 500th career goal, which turned out to be an incredible, acrobatic effort against Toronto FC. It was later nominated for goal of the season.Taking to their Twitter and social media pages, Galaxy simply wrote: 'The best of the best.'Congrats to @LAGalaxy forward @Ibra_official, the 2018 Newcomer of the Year! 👏 pic.twitter.com/oRMMVC9ZmlWayne Rooney was also a candidate for the award after a sublime debut year with DC UnitedMLS also took to social media to congratulate Ibrahimovic's exploits, sharing a series of videos of the striker's goals, assists and skill highlights.Though Ibrahimovic had an excellent debut campaign, it was not enough to get Galaxy into the postseason after a final day defeat to the Houston Dynamo.The Swede has a year remaining on his current Galaxy contract, though has been linked with one final move back to Europe, namely to former club AC Milan.His agent, Mino Raiola, refused to downplay the rumours, saying he and his client are 'prepared to talk.' Published by Associated Newspapers LtdPart of the Daily Mail, The Mail on Sunday & Metro Media Group
